result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael R. Kraemer

records.addlTxt:
10:38 AM 10:36 AM Defendant Michael R. Kraemer appeared by video, in custody from JCJ.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Carly June Sebion in court for Michael R. Kraemer. State in compliance with victim rights. Defendant agrees and understands to appear remotely.  Count 1, Defendant enters a plea of No Contest. Count 2, enters a plea of No Contest, Count 3 enters a plea of No Contest. Dismiss and Read-in remaining counts, 22CM2 & 22CM37 DRI. 
Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. He understood. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights. Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Counts 1 & 3 Disorderedly Conduct contrary to 947.01(1), Count 2 Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor contrary to 946.49(1)(a). Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution. 

Joint recommendation: 2 year probation w/conditions of costs, DNA. No contact w/Victim 1 unless agent approves, Risk and Needs assessment, AODA and follow through, Mental health and follow through. Maintain absolute sobriety. 46 days presentence credit. No objection to early 1 year release. 

Court adopts the joint recommendation: Sentence withheld, 2 years probation, No contact w/Victim 1 unless agent approves, The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. AODA and follow through and comply with any treatment. Mental health assessment and follow through. Maintain absolute sobriety. Subject to random testing. Must seek and maintain full-time employment or a combination of employment and education which is satisfactory to your probation agent.  Defendant  must not leave or change employment without prior approval of your probation agent. Court costs.  46 days jail credit, if revoked. Apply for discharge after 1 year if all completed and agent approves. 


The defendant is ORDERED  to report to the Jackson County Jail to submit the required DNA specimen and report for booking. Contact the Jackson County Sheriff's Department at 715-284-5357 to arrange for an appointment.

3:02 PM Defendant Michael R. Kraemer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Carly June Sebion appeared by video for Michael R. Kraemer. Attorney Sebion updates the court. Resolution worked out. Case scheduled on Judge Becker's branch. Parties doing a global resolution.

Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:00 PM Defendant Michael R. Kraemer appeared by video, in custody of the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court advised the defendant of the charges and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  He understood.  Court explained his attorney rights. Attorney Carly Sebion appeared via video. State no objection to signature bond with no contact provisions. victim 1 and her residence.  Atty Sebion no objection to signature bond or no contact at this time.
Discussion of putting this on with his 22CM2 case set for a plea hearing on 4/25.  AIA set for 5/9 at 9 am. PTC set for 4/20.
